Class GameView

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameView

  • public class GameView
extends java.lang.Object
    The View part of the MVC design
    Author:
    Tom Langwaldt

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameView

        private GameView()
        Constructor without parameters should never be called.

      • GameView

        public GameView(boolean isAutoplayMode,
                int windowWidth,
                int windowHeight,
                int rodCount,
                int maxDiskAmount)
        Creates a view object for the MVC model.
        Parameters:
        isAutoplayMode - Indicates whether the user is allowed to move disks or an algorithm solves the problem
        windowWidth - Width of the window in pixels
        windowHeight - Height of the window in pixels
        rodCount - Number of rods the view is supposed to display
        maxDiskAmount - Maximum number of disks which can be in the game at a time

    • Method Detail

      • fillContents

        private void fillContents(int windowWidth,
                          int windowHeight)
        Add all panels of the view to the main frame, including buttons and game visualization
        Parameters:
        windowWidth - Width of the window in pixels
        windowHeight - Height of the window in pixels

      • assignController

        public void assignController(GameController controller)
        Assigns the controller of the MVC design to the view. Is only needed for the callbacks the the controller, in case a user presses a button.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller of the MVC design
        See Also:
        GameController

      • drawDisk

        public void drawDisk(int rodIndex,
                     Disk disk)
        Draws a disk on the display, the next time it is painted. Every consecutive call is interpreted as another disk added on top. To start over, call resetView() and add tasks again.
        Parameters:
        rodIndex -
        disk -

      • resetView

        public void resetView()
        Clear all draw tasks. After this, the only things painted are the rods and step counter.
        See Also:
        DrawDiskTask

      • updateView

        public void updateView()
        Manually update the view in case a disk changes

      • showError

        public void showError(java.lang.String message)
        Displays a popup with a message, centered over the main window. Prevents the user from inputting anything until OK button was pressed.
        Parameters:
        message - What to display inside of the popup window.

      • getSelectedFromButton

        public int getSelectedFromButton()
        Gets the index of the currently selected button of the "from" row.
        Returns:
        The index of the pressed button, starting from the leftmost one at index 0. Is -1 in case none is pressed.

      • getSelectedToButton

        public int getSelectedToButton()
        Gets the index of the currently selected button of the "to" row.
        Returns:
        The index of the pressed button, starting from the leftmost one at index 0. Is -1 in case none is pressed.

      • incrementStepCount

        public void incrementStepCount()
        Increment the step counter of the UI by +1.

      • resetStepCount

        public void resetStepCount()
        Set the step counter of the UI to 0.

      • commitButtonEvent

        public void commitButtonEvent(java.awt.event.ActionEvent event)
        Sends the controller of the MVC design a message to handle what happens in case a user presses the commit button. Actually only needed if the UI is in interactive mode.
        Parameters:
        event - Holds information about the button press, not used.

      • resetButtonEvent

        public void resetButtonEvent(java.awt.event.ActionEvent event)
        Sends the controller of the MVC design a message to handle what happens in case a user presses the reset button.
        Parameters:
        event - Holds information about the button press, not used.

      • startButtonEvent

        public void startButtonEvent(java.awt.event.ActionEvent event)
        Sends the controller of the MVC design a message to handle what happens in case a user presses the start button. Actually only needed if the UI is in autoplay mode.
        Parameters:
        event - Holds information about the button press, not used.
